summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons incident report documenting an apparent suicide attempt by inmate Jeffery Epstein on July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The report details staff finding Epstein with a homemade rope around his neck in his cell and providing initial medical response.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found in his cell with a homemade rope around his neck in an apparent suicide attempt.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who alerted staff to the incident, stating Epstein had attempted to hang himself.

connections.description: They were housed together in cell 124 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the time of the incident.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, inmate Jeffery Epstein was found in his cell with an orange homemade rope around his neck in an apparent hanging attempt. He was breathing but unresponsive when staff intervened.

locations: NCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
SIR( M-Tier Cell 124 (Special Housing Unit, M-Tier, Cell 124)
keyFacts: The incident occurred on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Jeffery Epstein was found in his cell (Cell 124, M-Tier, Special Housing Unit) with an orange homemade rope around his neck.
Epstein's cellmate, Tartaglione, was at the cell door and alerted staff that Epstein had attempted to hang himself.
Staff removed the rope, found Epstein breathing but unresponsive, and then removed him from the SHU.
The incident was classified as 'Self-Mutilation' under Prohibited Act Code 228 and was referred to a Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO).
